subject: One More Chapter Done
event:
Well, I finished a chapter of the DANCE this morning.  Which ordinarily would not be occasion for comment, but this was a Bran chapter that I've been struggling with for something like six years.  Bran has always been the toughest character to write, for a whole bunch of reasons, but this chapter in particular was killing me.

Anyway, that's one done.  (Unless I wake up tomorrow, reread what I've done, decide that I hate it, and tear the whole thing up.  Which does happen from time to time).

Now let's hope the NEXT Bran chapter doesn't take six years as well.

comments.upictitle: move along, nothing to see here.: splendor
comments.article: I can't wait! ^o^

Six years? Ok, now I feel better about some of my Scenes That Never Fall Into Place. ;)

Congrats on getting it done, and here's to hope you'll still like it tomorrow.
Congrats. I love Bran so this is great news to hear. Hope the rest of the book doesn't hold you up so much.

Maybe things would be easier to write if you told Bran's story from Hodor's point of view. :P

Seriously, though, that's wonderful news!
Yeah, but a whole chapter of "Hodor hodor hodor, Hodorhodor."?

Congratulations on the chapter. Accept my congratulations....although I hope you don't read this, because Robin Hobb's rant about blogging and then reading the comments was worth taking to heart.

I am an academic with my own writing commitments, so her comments spoke directly to me. Her comments have inspired me to change my daily routine in my study, so that I get more writing done.
comments.subject: Congratulations

comments.article:
WHOOO!

Also, love the new layout.

I say if the next Bran chapter begins to take a long time to write as well, you kill him off unceremoniously and have done with it xD


Not really, though- I love Bran, and his story.

Congratulations!
He is running out of Starks, after all...

comments.subject: I thought Sansa was a blonde
Re: I thought Sansa was a blonde
Re: I thought Sansa was a blonde

comments.article: Oh, yay! Bran's one of my favorites, and I'm so happy to hear that his story is starting to pick up again. Congratulations on finishing, and good luck with the rest!
Good to hear it! I hope you still like it in the morning. And, I'm glafd you didn't take Robin Hobb to heart about not blogging, because I've said that if you did, I'd have to smite her.

comments.upictitle: OMG, it's a talking biscuit named Mara!: Nature-Redwood path
comments.article: Hurrah and a w00t! And let's throw in a dancing hamster for good measure.

... but.... that might just kill all of us! ;)

I can't wait. I've been trying to figure out where that story line is going to go, too, and I can't wait to see if I'm at least partially right....

More than anything, though... thank you from the bottom of my heart, Mr. Martin. These gifts are truly amazing!

Mazel tov on the chapter!

And ha, you and I apparently have the same journal style now. I always look at mine and think "dark wings, dark words," so it's appropriate on many levels. :D

Congrats on the chapter!  Now I know it's not just my imagination that Bran doesn't have as much "screen-time" as the rest.  I can see where he'd be difficult to write, so extra kudos for getting it done!

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: cocktail
comments.article: big w00t on that. I can't say I've ever been stuck on something for 6 years, but I know the feeling of finally breaking through the roadblock.

comments.upictitle: 野生キス Ain't no party like a permanent party.: Me - Fushia Smiling
comments.article:
Of course, that last sentence made several brains pop I suspect.

*cheers*

progress is progress. glad to hear you at least currently feel like things are in a semi-finished state.

though that bears the question of whether there are any sections of the published books that you've read since their publishing and wished that you'd done differently.

If I had won the lottery in 1995 or thereabouts, I'd never have published any of the books... yet. The ideal way to do something this size is to write the whole series in first draft, and then and only then, when the whole thing is complete, go back and begin to revise, taking things out, putting things in, etc.

That's the way Gene Wolfe wrote his Torturer series, and a big reason why those books are so masterful.

Alas, I did not win the lottery. If I'd tried to do it that way, I'd be homeless now. Either that, or back in Hollywood.
comments.subject: published books

comments.upictitle: Popular series of fiction, fancy, and fact.: Benevolent sense of life
comments.article: Now this is a blog post I can get behind. Take that, Robin Hobb.

So the two, possibly three, obvious questions are:

Is this a first draft of the chapter (and if so, how much do you revise)?

And how many chapters do you have left to write before the book is finished?

I revise constantly.

There are lines and paragraphs in this chapter that are first draft, yes. The ones I wrote yesterday and the day before. But they're cheek by jowl with other lines and paragraphs that are six years old and have been revised fifty times.

Not the most efficient way to work, I know. But it's my way, at least at this point in my career.
comments.subject: first draft?

comments.article: on behalf of everyone in the world, congratulations, and thank you :)

Yay!

The BF has complained of Bran's chapters being boring but I find them a lovely respite from the super-hectic plot lines of other characters... It's a good chance to sit back, relate to a character's frustrations and hopes and fears and all the rest, and not have to keep 1000 plot threads in my head until the next character chapter. -cough-anyandalllannisters-cough-

I don't think anyone will find this Bran chapter boring. A couple of things that happened surprised even me.

That being said, the rough partial that existed around the time I turned in FEAST FOR CROWS certainly was boring, which is why I kept going back and banging my head against it over and over.
comments.subject: boring

comments.article: Congrats on the chapter.  Please don't tear it up tomorrow.
Congrats on completing the chapter. It's so hard to get over those creative blocks sometimes. Hopefully the next one will go easier for you ^_^

Horray!

Also, while I can imagine why Bran is so hard, I love his character (okay so Arya is my fave), and I generally love how you have so many characters of different ages, gender, bodytypes... yeah. And not all "mary sues" (or the male equivalent) which is what it seems 99% of fantasy is :P

You are a top notch writer!
Hmm...Well...what if you just let us read it and tell you if we like it? We're honest =D
comments.subject: So George

comments.article: I don't think honesty is the question lol
comments.subject: Re: So George

comments.article:
honestly, i dont really like bran chapters. i'd rather read something about arya or or tyrion or dany or even cersei.

way to go george! this book is much anticipated. i feel so relieved that you're about to finish it.
Bran and Jon are my bread'n'butter. Feast was awesome, but their absence was torture!
